value.description: It emphasized the importance of the representational role of system; that is, the system must present data in such a way that they are interpretable, easy to understand, and concisely and consistently represented.

value.name: Representational Adequacy
value.description: Degree to which a data store presents data in a concise and organized way

subproperties.name: Schema Minimality
subproperties.details: Degree to which the schema is modelled without redundancies

subproperties.name: Schema Normalization
subproperties.details: Degree to which the schema is de-/normalized

subproperties.name: Schema Pertinence
subproperties.details: Degree to which the schema is modelled without unnecessary elements

value.name: Representational Consistency
value.description: Degree to which a data store presents data always in the same format and compatible with previous data

subproperties.name: Data Format Variety
subproperties.details: Refers to the amount of different data formats used by a data store to present data.

subproperties.name: Data Type Variety
subproperties.details: Refers to the amount of different data types used by a data store to present data.

subproperties.name: Schema Change Proneness
subproperties.details: Degree to which the schema is likely to change in the future.

value.name: Understandability
value.description: Degree to which users can understand the data provided by a data store.

subproperties.name: Data Format Complexity
subproperties.details: Describes the overall complexity of the data format used by a data store to represent the data; It Includes aspects such as the amount of proprietary/open data formats used and the possibility to process the data format directly (i.e. no transformations needed); it also takes into account whether the data are presented in a clear, simple and well structured way.

subproperties.name: Documentation Degree
subproperties.details: Degree to which a data store provides useful and complete documentation.

subproperties.name: Metadata Quality
subproperties.details: Degree to which a data store provides metadata that are available, complete, useful, interpretable and human readable; it also takes into account the availability of data dictionaries or repositories.

subproperties.name: Schema Readability
subproperties.details: Degree to which the schema is modelled in a natural, clear and self-explanatory way.

value.description: It emphasized the importance of the dynamic role of system; that is, the system must be secure, available, accessible and provide up-to-date data with high performance.

value.name: Accessibility
value.description: Degree to which data are easily and quickly retrievable

subproperties.name: Access Maturity
subproperties.details: Degree to which provided access methods (e.g. APIs) and protocols of a data store are mature and reliable.

subproperties.name: Operability
subproperties.details: Degree to which a data store provides possibilities (e.g. management system, navigation mechanisms) that guides the access to it.

subproperties.name: Retrievability
subproperties.details: Degree to which query possibilities of a data store are mature, reliable and require no additional requirements (e.g. registration).

value.name: Availability
value.description: Degree to which data are available from a data store.

subproperties.name: Durability
subproperties.details: Degree to which a data store keeps the data available for retrieval.

subproperties.name: Fault Tolerance
subproperties.details: Degree to which a data store operates as intended despite the presence of hardware or software faults (e.g. CAP, ACID, BASE).

subproperties.name: Recoverability
subproperties.details: Degree to which a data store can re-establish the desired operating state after an interruption or failure (e.g. CAP, ACID, BASE).

subproperties.name: Scalability
subproperties.details: Degree to which a data store can deal with varying workloads without downtimes.

subproperties.name: Uptime
subproperties.details: Degree to which a data store is up and running, i.e. reachable (e.g. CAP, ACID, BASE).

value.name: Security
value.description: Degree to which access to data for unauthorized persons is restricted by a data store.

subproperties.name: Authentification/Encryption
subproperties.details: Degree to which authentification and encryption are ensured by a data store.

subproperties.name: Authorization Policy
subproperties.details: Degree to which authorization policies are in place on a data store.

value.name: Timeliness
value.description: Degree to which a data store provides up-to-date data in timely manner

subproperties.name: Refresh Rate
subproperties.details: Degree to which the time interval between the occurrence of an event and the availablity of the data (which describe this event) on the data store sufficient.

subproperties.name: Response Time
subproperties.details: Degree to which the response and processing times of a data store are sufficient.

value.description: It emphasized the importance of the static role of system; that is, the system must be complete and trustworthy as well as provide support capabilities.

value.name: Completeness
value.description: Degree to which a data store is able to represent every meaningful state of the real world.

subproperties.name: Schema Completeness
subproperties.details: Degree to which all real-world concepts are represented in the schema (complete representation).

subproperties.name: Schema Correctness
subproperties.details: Degree to which the schema corresponds to the real-world it is supposed to model (correct representation).

value.name: Contactability
value.description: Degree to which a data store provides contact information for further inquiries.

subproperties.name: Support Degree
subproperties.details: Describes the overall degree of support; it includes aspects such as service agreements, availability of previous developers and domain experts.

value.name: Trustworthiness
value.description: Degree to which a data store can be trusted.

subproperties.name: Complexity
subproperties.details: Describes the overall complexity of a data store; it includes aspects such as the complexity of the data model, the schema size and the extent of data processing/transforming; it also takes into account whether the data store type is known to the current developers.

subproperties.name: Data Governance
subproperties.details: Degree to which data governance principles (e.g. data policies, cleaning, backup etc.) are applied on a data store.

subproperties.name: Maturity
subproperties.details: Degree to which a data store is reliable (i.e. not prone to failures), stable (i.e. no recent upgrades, changes) and current (.e. latest stable software release installed).

subproperties.name: Verifiability
subproperties.details: Degree to which a data store provides information on the data origin, on changes made to the data and possibilities to check the data for correctness.
